notes.text:
An update for libxslt is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
libxslt is a library for transforming XML files into other textual formats (including HTML, plain text, and other XML representations of the underlying data) using the standard XSLT stylesheet transformation mechanism. 

Security Fix(es):

* libxslt: xsltCheckRead and xsltCheckWrite routines security bypass by crafted URL (CVE-2019-11068)

* libxslt: use after free in xsltCopyText in transform.c could lead to information disclosure (CVE-2019-18197)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: libxslt through 1.1.33 allows bypass of a protection mechanism because callers of xsltCheckRead and xsltCheckWrite permit access even upon receiving a -1 error code. xsltCheckRead can return -1 for a crafted URL that is not actually invalid and is subsequently loaded.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxslt: xsltCheckRead and xsltCheckWrite routines security bypass by crafted URL
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat OpenStack will consume fixes from the base Red Hat Enterprise Linux Operating System. Therefore the package provided by Red Hat OpenStack has been marked as will not fix.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

This flaw only applies to applications compiled against libxml2 which use xsltCheckRead and xsltCheckWrite functions and/or allow users to load arbitrary URLs to be parsed via libxml2. In all other cases, applications are not vulnerable.

vulnerabilities.title: libxslt: xsltCheckRead and xsltCheckWrite routines security bypass by crafted URL

notes.text: In xsltCopyText in transform.c in libxslt 1.1.33, a pointer variable isn't reset under certain circumstances. If the relevant memory area happened to be freed and reused in a certain way, a bounds check could fail and memory outside a buffer could be written to, or uninitialized data could be disclosed.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: libxslt: use after free in xsltCopyText in transform.c could lead to information disclosure
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat OpenStack consumes fixes from the base Red Hat Enterprise Linux Operating System. Therefore the libxslt package provided by Red Hat OpenStack has been marked as 'will not fix'.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability
